intro: Dalechampia scandens var. fimbriata, commonly known as the fimbriate sycamore or sycamore tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a soft, hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along riverbanks and in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value comes from its unique foliage and ability to provide shade in shaded environments.
